channel.title: Comments on: Vote on your favourite logo for Web2Ireland

item.content:encoded: [...] branding to improve with new logo – Thanks to all submissions and votes – the Web2Ireland community voted to an entry from [...]

item.title: By: Daniel Becker
item.dc:creator: Daniel Becker
item.description:
Hi, I can't offer you an alternative logo but I can offer an alternative way of collecting the votes :-)
http://glowday.com/survey_widget/T5WJI4DFDDK
Daniel
PS. Look out for the GlowDay site redesign next week....
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
I can’t offer you an alternative logo but I can offer an alternative way of collecting the votes

http://glowday.com/survey_widget/T5WJI4DFDDK

Daniel

PS. Look out for the GlowDay site redesign next week….

item.title: By: Kido
item.dc:creator: Kido
item.description: I'm confused. The correct name for website is Web2Ireland or Web 2.0 Ireland?
item.content:encoded: I’m confused. The correct name for website is Web2Ireland or Web 2.0 Ireland?

item.title: By: Aido
item.dc:creator: Aido
item.description: If you stand your Macbook/monitor on its side no. 2-5 almost look like a body piercing.
item.content:encoded: If you stand your Macbook/monitor on its side no. 2-5 almost look like a body piercing.

item.title: By: Derek Organ
item.dc:creator: Derek Organ
item.description: I think your better off sticking with the site the way it is than add one of those .. if i had to choose i'd choose number 1 but even that needs work.
item.content:encoded: I think your better off sticking with the site the way it is than add one of those .. if i had to choose i’d choose number 1 but even that needs work.

item.title: By: Marcus Mac Innes
item.dc:creator: Marcus Mac Innes
item.description:
Not a huge fan of any of the above either... The majority already look dated. Web 2.0 reflections and gradients... bahhh. Reminds me of something you'd knock up with http://www.smashupgraphics.com/smashups/web-20-logo
I agree with Michele in that only (1) looks "bearable".
item.content:encoded:
Not a huge fan of any of the above either… The majority already look dated. Web 2.0 reflections and gradients… bahhh. Reminds me of something you’d knock up with http://www.smashupgraphics.com/smashups/web-20-logo

I agree with Michele in that only (1) looks “bearable”.

item.title: By: Michele
item.dc:creator: Michele
item.description: The only one that's "bearable" is number 1 and even that one is pretty awful
item.content:encoded: The only one that’s “bearable” is number 1 and even that one is pretty awful

item.title: By: Eoghan McCabe
item.dc:creator: Eoghan McCabe
item.description: Tom, I love ya, but since when was the mark of a good logo "better than Tom would come up with"? :-)
item.content:encoded: Tom, I love ya, but since when was the mark of a good logo “better than Tom would come up with”?

item.title: By: Bob
item.dc:creator: Bob
item.description: Maybe open the comp again, and go for a more sober, less web 2.0, and shiny floors look. http://img262.imageshack.us/img262/4654/54479179nf0.png/
item.content:encoded: Maybe open the comp again, and go for a more sober, less web 2.0, and shiny floors look. http://img262.imageshack.us/img262/4654/54479179nf0.png/

item.title: By: Tom Raftery
item.dc:creator: Tom Raftery
item.description:
Ah now lads - in fairness any of those logos are better than anything I'd come up with.
I do agree though that a None of the above option should be included with the poll.
item.content:encoded:
Ah now lads – in fairness any of those logos are better than anything I’d come up with.

I do agree though that a None of the above option should be included with the poll.
